Posts.Content: Jan 29, 2012 11:06AM marinakaplan wrote: I embarassed to admit that I used to hate exercise before chemo, it was a real chore that I'd force myself to do a couple of times a week.  But my onc told me that excercise helps with the fatigue many people experience with chemo. So now I exercise (at home) 7 days a week for an hour a day on the eliptical at highest resistance and the treadmill at the highest incline (3.5 mph), as well as yoga 2-3 times a week and power-walking outside whenever possible. I've done this every day since I started chemo except for the 3 days following each infusion (those are my nausea days). Well my onc was right, exercise has really helped me avoid fatigue. I find that if I'm feeling tired and really want to just go and have a nap, I'll get on the treadmill or the eliptical instead and it makes me feel perky, happy and energetic and totally gets rid of the fatigue!! If I do give in and go have a nap, I wake up tired and irritable! I've also continued to work full time and I think that the exercise has enabled me to have the energy to keep on working. I'm on the dose dense regime (AC every 2 weeks for 8 weeks, I'll be starting taxol Feb 23 every week for 12 weeks plus herceptin every 3 weeks for a year).
